meanings.definition: Actively break the terms of (a law, agreement, etc.)
meanings.sent1: He constantly infringes on the rules by arriving late every day.
meanings.sent2: She was fined for infringing the speed limit on the highway.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat infringes on the dog's personal space by sitting on its bed.
meanings.sent4: Ignoring the 'No Entry' sign, he boldly infringes into the restricted area.
meanings.sent5: The student's habit of talking during exams clearly infringes on the school's policy.

meanings.definition: Encroach or trespass on (someone's rights, privacy, etc.)
meanings.sent1: The loud music from the party next door infringes on my ability to concentrate.
meanings.sent2: The construction noise infringes on the peaceful atmosphere of the neighborhood.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel playfully infringes on the bird's feeding area, causing a commotion.
meanings.sent4: The invasive vine seems to infringe on every corner of the garden, spreading rapidly.
meanings.sent5: The bright streetlights infringe on the darkness of the night sky, making stargazing difficult.
